title: Looking for a typeface similar to Klavika
content:
hmmm... any one knows something like klavika but a lowest price??? inforttunaly the I don't have the budget for klavika ...

comments.content:
Ray Larabie may have something -- like [Forgotten Futurist](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043601/http:/www.dafont.com/forgotten-futurist.font?nb_ppp=50&text=MRS+Wilfy+C+Gadget+Jr).

What is your budget, and how many font styles (bold, italics, small caps) do you need?

you might look at reform from psyops

[http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_reform.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043601/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_reform.html "http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_reform.html")

Thanks bowfinpw for the sugestion of forgotten futurist...  
I need two regular heights [light and normal] and I have about 100 euros to spend on it stephen.  
Reform from psyops it's a nice option... thanks hereandthere.  
Any more sugestions??

||jmendes||

[FF Max Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043601/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_max_light_tf/) and [FF Max Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043601/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_max_book/)

Thanks for your suggestions stephen... some of them I already have in my list... they are a god options for my intentions...  
||jmendes||

\> I need two regular heights [light and normal] and I have about 100 euros to spend on it stephen.

A little late to the party, but you can buy Klavika Basic as a pack which includes 2 weights, each with italics for 99USD.
Ups!... to late indeed ... I decide to use Neo Sans... next time maybe ... thanks Nicole
I'm sorry I missed that, Nicole.
No problem... There's always next time!

The nice thing about Process is that if you buy a basic pack, you can apply the cost to purchasing the full face later. I wish all foundries had that policy.

Sharon
